intro: Hieracium pachyodon, commonly known as the thick-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its thick, sturdy stems are adapted for supporting its flowering structure and are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Hieracium pachyodon thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and woodland edges.
